translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Triad-Couplet-Conditioned Arising Discourse

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.56. Sanidassanattika, Lokiyaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ lokiyaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nasanidassanasappaṭigho nalokiyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi … avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika lokiya duka  anidassana appaṭigham lokiyam dhammam paccayā na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ na lokiyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi avigate tīṇi
translated: With-object-surface, mundane triad🔽With-object-surface and impinging, mundane states are conditionally due to non-with-object-surface and non-impinging, non-mundane states as root-cause condition. (In brief.) With respect to root-cause, there are three. … With respect to non-hindrance, there are three.

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ lokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nalokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham lokuttaram dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na lokuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With-object-surface and impinging, supramundane states are conditionally due to non-with-object-surface and non-impinging, non-supramundane states as root-cause condition. (In brief.) With respect to root-cause, there are six. … With respect to non-hindrance, there are six.
